tool.name: SCCS
tool.summary: Sets construction variables for interacting with the Source Code Control System.

cvar.name: SCCSCOM
cvar.summary: The command line used to fetch source files from SCCS.

cvar.name: SCCSCOMSTR
cvar.summary: The string displayed when fetching a source file from a CVS repository. If this is not set, then &cv-link-SCCSCOM; (the command line) is displayed.

cvar.name: SCCSFLAGS
cvar.summary: General options that are passed to SCCS.

cvar.name: SCCSGETFLAGS
cvar.summary: Options that are passed specifically to the SCCS "get" subcommand. This can be set, for example, to -e to check out editable files from SCCS.

scons_function.name: SCCS
scons_function.summary:
A factory function that returns a Builder object to be used to fetch source files from SCCS. The returned Builder is intended to be passed to the &f-link-SourceCode; function.
Example:
env.SourceCode('.', env.SCCS())
Note that &scons; will fetch source files from SCCS subdirectories automatically, so configuring SCCS as demonstrated in the above example should only be necessary if you are fetching from s.SCCS files in the same directory as the source files, or if you need to explicitly specify SCCS for a specific subdirectory.
